alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 20 at 10:00PM EST until November 21 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 10 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Harlan and Letcher Counties. * WHEN...through noon EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. A few tree limbs could be blown down and result in some power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wind gust intensity will be variable across the advisory area. The strongest wind gusts, up to 50 mph, are expected to occur over and immediately northwest of Black and Pine mountains, including Route 119, Route 421, Route 23, Kentucky Highway 932, and Kentucky Highway 160. The area of greatest concern also includes portions of the communities of Bledsoe, Cumberland, Lynch, Eolia, Mayking, Payne Gap, and Jenkins. Away from these prominent mountains and locations immediately to their northwest, wind gusts up to 40 mph are expected.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
